availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph S. Durham (Green County, Kentucky, merchant.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Nannie J. Miller Durham in Green County, Kentucky, on December 20, 1858. Father of Mary Eliza Durham, Margaret "Maggie" M. Durham, Ida S. Durham, and John W. Durham. Merchant in Green County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Greensburg, p. 626.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Greensburg, p. 77A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Greensburg, p. 432A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Births.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Marriages.
"Rollingburg," The Adair County News (Columbia, KY), June 11, 1902, p. 4.
"Joseph Shreve Durham (1830-1902)," Find A Grave, Memorial 73272008, accessed March 10, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/73272008.
